ncmcm.bundlenet package

Submodules

ncmcm.bundlenet.BundDLeNet module

class ncmcm.bundlenet.BundDLeNet.BundDLeNet(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Behaviour and Dynamical Learning Network (BundDLeNet) model.

This model represents the BundDLeNet’s architecture for deep learning and is based on the commutativity diagrams. The resulting model is dynamically consistent (DC) and behaviourally consistent (BC) as per the notion described in the paper.

Parameters:
  • latent_dim: int, required

    Dimension of the latent space.

  • behaviors: int, required

    Number of different behaviors.

call(X)[source]

ncmcm.bundlenet.BundDLeNet.bandpass(traces, f_l, f_h, sampling_freq)[source]

Apply a bandpass filter to the input traces.

Parameters:
  • traces: np.ndarray, required

    Input traces to be filtered.

  • f_l: float, required

    Lower cutoff frequency in Hz.

  • f_h: float, required

    Upper cutoff frequency in Hz.

  • sampling_freq: float, required

    Sampling frequency in Hz.

Returns:
  • filtered: np.ndarray

    Filtered traces.

ncmcm.bundlenet.BundDLeNet.bccdcc_loss(yt1_upper, yt1_lower, bt1_upper, b_train_1, gamma, discrete=True)[source]

Calculate the loss for the BundDLeNet.

Parameters:
  • yt1_upper: np.ndarray, required

    Output from the upper arm of the BundDLeNet.

  • yt1_lower: np.ndarray, required

    Output from the lower arm of the BundDLeNet.

  • bt1_upper: np.ndarray, required

    Predicted output from the upper arm of the BundDLeNet.

  • b_train_1: np.ndarray, required

    True output for training.

  • gamma: float, required

    Tunable weight for the DCC loss component.

  • discrete: bool, optional

    Whether the loss should be calculated for discrete data.

Returns:
  • return: tuple

    A tuple containing the DCC loss, behavior loss, and total loss.

ncmcm.bundlenet.BundDLeNet.prep_data(X, B, win=15)[source]

Prepares the data for the BundDLeNet algorithm by formatting the input neuronal and behavioral traces.

Parameters:
  • X: np.ndarray, required

    Raw neuronal traces of shape (n, t), where n is the number of neurons and t is the number of time steps.

  • B: np.ndarray, required

    Raw behavioral traces of shape (t,), representing the behavioral data corresponding to the neuronal traces.

  • win: int, optional

    Length of the window to feed as input to the algorithm. If win > 1, a slice of the time series is used as input.

Returns:
  • X_paired: np.ndarray

    Paired neuronal traces of shape (m, 2, win, n), where m is the number of paired windows, 2 represents the current and next time steps, win is the length of each window, and n is the number of neurons.

  • B_1: np.ndarray

    Behavioral traces corresponding to the next time step, of shape (m,). Each value represents the behavioral data corresponding to the next time step in the paired neuronal traces.

ncmcm.bundlenet.BundDLeNet.preprocess_data(X, fps)[source]

Preprocesses the input data by applying bandpass filtering.

Parameters:
  • X: numpy.ndarray, required

    Input data to be preprocessed.

  • fps: float, required

    Frames per second.

Returns:
  • return: numpy.ndarray

    Preprocessed data after bandpass filtering.

ncmcm.bundlenet.BundDLeNet.tf_batch_prep(X_, B_, batch_size=100)[source]

Prepare datasets for TensorFlow by creating batches.

This function prepares datasets for TensorFlow by creating batches. It takes input data ‘X_’ and target data ‘B_’ and creates a TensorFlow dataset from them. The function returns the prepared batch dataset, which will be used for training the TensorFlow model.

Parameters:
  • X_: np.ndarray, required

    Input data of shape (n_samples, …).

  • B_: np.ndarray, required

    Target data of shape (n_samples, …).

  • batch_size: int, optional

    Size of the batches to be created. Default is 100.

Returns:
  • batch_dataset: tf.data.Dataset

    TensorFlow dataset containing batches of input data and target data.

ncmcm.bundlenet.BundDLeNet.train_model(X_train, B_train_1, model, optimizer, gamma, n_epochs)[source]

Training BundDLeNet

Parameters:
  • X_train: np.ndarray, required

    Training input data.

  • B_train_1: np.ndarray, required

    Training output data.

  • model: BunDLeNet, required

    Instance of the BundDLeNet class.

  • optimizer: tf.keras.optimizers.Optimizer, required

    Optimizer for model training.

  • gamma: float, required

    Weight for the DCC loss component.

  • n_epochs: int, required

    Number of training epochs.

Returns:
  • return: numpy.ndarray

    Array of loss values during training.
